data.quote: I have sat through an Italian opera  til  for sheer pain  and inexplicable anguish  I have rushed out into the noisiest places of the crowded street  to solace myself with sounds which I was not obliged to follow and get rid of the distracting torment of endless  fruitless  barren attention!

data.quote: Discord occasions a momentary distress to the ear  which remains unsatisfied  and even uneasy  until it hears something better. I am convinced...that provided the ear be at length made amends  there are few dissonances too strong for it. Disharmony  to paraphrase Bergson's statement about disorder  is simply a harmony to which many are unaccustomed.
data.author: John Cage

data.author: Ed Gardner

data.quote: I think popular music in this country is one of the few things in the twentieth century that have made giant strides in reverse.

data.author: Aaron Copland

data.quote: Music is given to us specifically to make order of things  to move from an anarchic  individualistic state to a regulated  perfectly concious one  which alone insures vitality and durability.

data.quote: Music hath charms to soothe the savage breast.
data.author: William Congreve

data.quote: Soprano  basso  even the contralto Wished him five fathom under the Rialto.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Why should the devil have all the good tunes?
data.author: Rowland Hill

data.quote: The musician who always plays on the same string  is laughed at.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: All of heaven we have below.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: Such sweet compulsion doth in music lie.

data.author: George Moore

data.quote: Wagner's music is better than it sounds.

data.quote: Light quirks of music  broken and uneven  Make the soul dance upon a jig to Heav'n.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: There was the door to which I found no key  There was the veil through which 1 might not see.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: There be three things which are too wonderful for me  yea  four which I know not: the way of an eagle in the air  the way of a serpent upon a rock  the way of a ship in the midst of the sea  and the way of a man with a maid.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Mystery is the wisdom of blockheads.
data.author: Horace Walpole

data.author: English proverb

data.author: Eugene Field

data.author: Bible

data.quote: And  lo! Ben Adhem's name led all the rest.
data.author: Leigh Hunt

data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I cannot tell what the dickens his name is.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: But he that filches from me my good name Robs me of that which not enriches him  And makes me poor indeed.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: What's in a name? that which we call a rose By any other name would smell as sweet.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Nationalism is an infantile disease. It is the measles of mankind.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Born in inquity and conceived in sin  the spirit of nationalism has never ceased to bend human institutions to the service of dissension and distress.
data.author: Thorstein Veblen

data.quote: The course of nature is the art of God.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: After a debauch of thundershower  the weather takes the pledge and signs it with a rainbow.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: From the intrinsic evidence of His creation  the Great Architect of the Universe now begins to appear as a pure mathematician .
data.author: Sir James Jeans

data.quote: Is dishwater dull? Naturalists with microscopes have told me that it teems with quiet fun.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: It is not necessarily those lands which are the most fertile or most favored climate that seem to me the happiest  but those in which a long stroke of adaptation between man and his environment has brought out the best qualities of both.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Like a gardener  I believe that what goes down must come up.
data.author: Lynwood L. Giacomini

data.quote: Nature is a catchment of sorrows.
data.author: Maxine Kumin

data.quote: Nature is not human-hearted.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: Nature  with equal mind  sees all her sons at play  sees man control the wind  the wind sweep man away.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: The chess-board is the world  the pieces are the phenomena of the universe  the rules of the game are what we call the Laws of Nature. The player on the other side is hidden from us. We know that his play is always fair  just and patient. But also we know  to our cost  that he never overlooks a mistake  or makes the smallest allowance for ignorance.
data.author: Thomas Huxley

data.quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The unnatural - that too is natural.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: There is one glory of the sun and another glory of the moon and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.

data.quote: There is something haunting in the light of the moon  it has all the dispassionateness of a disembodied soul  and something of its inconceivable mystery.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: The universe is not hostile  nor yet is it friendly. It is simply indifferent.
data.author: John Hughes Holmes

data.quote: In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments - there are consequences.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: Monotony is the law of nature. Look at the monotonous manner in which the sun rises. The monotony of necessary occupations is exhilarating and life-giving.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: Men argue  nature acts.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Nature is usually wrong.
data.author: James McNeill Whistler

data.quote: Speak to the earth  and it shall teach thee.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Flowers have an expression of countenance as much as men or animals. Some seem to smile  some have a sad expression  some are pensive and diffident  others again are plain  honest and upright.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Gie me a spark o' nature's fire  that's a' the learning I desire.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: Light may be shed on man and his origins.
data.author: Charles Darwin

data.quote: I have called this principle  by which each slight variation  if useful  is preserved  by the term natural selection.
data.author: Charles Darwin

data.quote: The expression often used by Mr. Herbert Spencer  of the "Survival of the fittest"  is more accurate  and is sometimes equally convenient.
data.author: Charles Darwin

data.quote: Nature is reckless of the individual. When she has points to carry  she carries them
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I wanted to say something about the universe. There's God  angels  plants... and horseshit.
data.author: Zero Mostel

data.quote: When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers.
data.author: African saying

data.quote: The dinosaur's eloquent lesson is that if some bigness is good  an overabundance of bigness is not necessarily better.
data.author: Eric Johnston

data.quote: Who are we? We find that we live on an insignificant planet of a humdrum star lost in a galaxy tucked away in some forgotten corner of a universe in which there are far more galaxies than people.
data.author: Carl Sagan

data.quote: A vacuum is a hell of a lot better than some of the stuff that nature replaces it with.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: We cannot command Nature except by obeying her.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: The mastery of nature is vainly believed to be an adequate substitute for self-mastery.
data.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

data.quote: Nature thrives on patience  man on impatience.
data.author: Paul Boese

data.quote: The soil  in return for her service  keeps the tree tied to her  the sky asks nothing and leaves it free.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: What mighty battles have I seen and heard waged between the trees and the west wind - an Iliad fought in the fields of air.
data.author: Edith M. Thomas

data.quote: Grass is the forgiveness of nature - her constant benediction. Forests decay  harvests perish  flowers vanish  but grass is immortal.
data.author: Brian Ingalls

data.quote: I frequently tramped eight or ten miles through the deepest snow to keep an appointment with a beech tree  or a yellow birch  or an old acquaintance among the pines.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The whole of nature is a conjugation of the verb to eat  in the active and passive.
data.author: Dean William R. Inge

data.quote: The universe is like a safe to which there is a combination  but the combination is locked up in the safe.
data.author: Peter de Vries

data.quote: When the oak is felled the whole forest echoes with its fall  but a hundred acorns are sown in silence by an unnoticed breeze.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Deep in their roots  all flowers keep the light.
data.author: Theodore Roethke

data.quote: By nature's kindly disposition  most questions which it is beyond man's power to answer do not occur to him at all.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: To demand 'sense' is the hallmark of nonsense. Nature does not make sense. Nothing makes sense.
data.author: Ayn Rand

data.quote: The bluebird carries the sky on his back.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.
data.author: Robert Lynd

data.quote: The greatest joy in nature is the absence of man.
data.author: Bliss Carman

data.quote: When a man wantonly destroys a work of man we call him a vandal  when a man destroys one of the works of God  we call him a sportsman.
data.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

data.quote: Man is a complex being: he makes deserts bloom and lakes die.
data.author: Gil Stern

data.quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: God's miracles are to be found in nature itself  the wind and waves  the wood that becomes a tree - all of these are explained biologically  but behind them is the hand of God.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: When I first open my eyes upon the morning meadows and look out upon the beautiful world  I thank God I am alive.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If you wish to know the divine  feel the wind on your face and the warm sun on your hand.
data.author: Eido Tai Shimano Roshi

data.quote: The radiance in some places is so great as to be fairly dazzling . . . every crystal  every flower a window opening into heaven  a mirror reflecting the Creator.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: Nature is too thin a screen  the glory of the omnipresent God bursts through everywhere.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: Look deep  deep into nature  and then you will understand everything better.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Come forth into the light of things. Let nature be your teacher.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: If you watch how nature deals with adversity  continually renewing itself  you can't help but learn.
data.author: Bernie Siegel

data.quote: Rivers and rocks and trees have always been talking to us  but we've forgotten how to listen.
data.author: Michael Roads

data.quote: Speak to the earth  and it shall teach thee.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings: Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine into flowers  the winds will blow their freshness into you  and the storms  their energy and cares will drop off like autumn leaves.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: Nature tops the list of potent tranquilizers and stress reducers. The mere sound of moving water has been shown to lower blood pressure.
data.author: Patch Adams

data.quote: The sun - my almighty physician.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns  so each small piece of her fabric reveals the organization of the entire tapestry.
data.author: Richard Feynman

data.quote: The finest workers in stone are not copper or steel tools  but the gentle touches of air and water working at their leisure with a liberal allowance of time.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: To the dull mind all nature is leaden. To the illumined mind the whole world burns and sparkles with light.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The beauty of the world and the orderly arrangement of everything celestial makes us confess that there is an excellent and eternal nature  which ought to be worshiped and admired by all mankind.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: The sun gives us light  but the moon provides inspiration. If you look at the sun without shielding your eyes  you'll go blind. If you look at the moon without covering your eyes  you'll become a poet.
data.author: Serge Bouchard

data.quote: The world is full of poetry. The air is living with its spirit  and the waves dance to the music of its melodies  and sparkle in its brightness.
data.author: Percival

data.quote: The sky is the daily bread of the eyes.
data.author: Ralph Walso Emerson

data.quote: My heart leaps up when I behold a rainbow in the sky.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: The bluebird carries the sky on his back.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
data.author: John Muir

data.quote: We lose our souls if we lose the experience of the forest  the butterflies  the song of the birds  if we can't see the stars at night.
data.author: Thomas Berry

data.quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: As long as the Earth can make a spring every year  I can. As long as the Earth can flower and produce nurturing fruit  I can  because I'm the Earth. I won't give up until the Earth gives up.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I never knew how soothing trees are - many trees and patches of open sunlight  and tree presences  it is almost like having another being.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Nature is saturated with deity.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection  not in books alone but in every leaf of springtime.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: The nicest thing about the promise of spring is that sooner or later she'll have to keep it.
data.author: Mark Beltaire

data.quote: Spring is nature's way of saying  "Let's party!"
data.author: Robin Williams

data.quote: It was one of those perfect summer days - the sun was shining  a breeze was blowing  the birds were singing  and the lawnmower was broken.
data.author: James Dent

data.quote: Nobody sees a flower - really - it is so small it takes time -  we haven't time - and to see takes time  like to have a friend takes time.
data.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

data.quote: Consider the lilies of the field  how they grow  they neither toil nor spin  yet I tell you  even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The AmenT of Nature is always a flower.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Next time a sunrise steals your breath or a meadow of flowers leave you speechless  remain that way. Say nothing  and listen as heaven whispers  "Do you like it? I did it just for you."
data.author: Max Lucado

data.quote: Every flower is a soul blossoming in Nature.
data.author: Gerard de Nerval

data.quote: Flowers always make people better  happier  and more helpful  they are sunshine  food  and medicine to the soul.
data.author: Luther Burbank

data.quote: Earth laughs in flowers.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: God Almighty first planted a garden. And indeed it is the purest of human pleasures.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Pleasure for an hour  a bottle of wine  pleasure for a year  marriage  pleasure for a lifetime  a garden.
data.author: Chinese saying

data.quote: The kiss of sun for pardon  The song of the birds for mirth One is nearer God's Heart in a garden Than anywhere else on earth.
data.author: Dorothy Gurney

data.quote: All gardeners live in beautiful places because they make them so.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: All gardening is landscape painting.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have not yet been discovered.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: For many years I was self-appointed inspector of snowstorms and rainstorms  and did my duty faithfully  though I never received one cent for it.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The next time it begins to rain ... lie down on your belly  nestle your chin into the grass  and get a frog's-eye view of how raindrops fall . . . The sight of hundreds of blades of grass bowing down and popping back up like piano keys strikes me as one of the merriest sights in the world.
data.author: Malcolm Margolin

data.quote: Sunshine is delicious  rain is refreshing  wind braces us up  snow is exhilarating  there is really no such thing as bad weather  only different kinds of good weather.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Don't knock the weather  nine-tenths of the people couldn't start a conversation if it didn't change once in a while.
data.author: Kin Hubbard

data.quote: After rain comes fair weather.
data.author: James Howell

data.quote: Weather means more when you have a garden. There's nothing like listening to a shower and thinking how it is soaking in around your green beans.
data.author: Marcelene Cox

data.quote: This is the day the Lord had made. We will rejoice and be glad in it.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day  a fresh try  one more start  with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.
data.author: J. B. Priestly

data.quote: Whether one is twenty  forty  or sixty  whether one has succeeded  failed or just muddled along  whether yesterday was full of sun or storm  or one of those dull days with no weather at all  life begins each morning I
data.author: Leigh Mitchell Hodges

data.quote: Today a new sun rises for me  everything lives  everything is animated  everything seems to speak to me of my passion  everything invites me to cherish it.
data.author: Anne De Lenclos

data.quote: Every new day begins with possibilities. It's up to us to fill it with the things that move us toward progress and peace.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: I love the challenge of starting at zero every day and seeing how much I can accomplish.
data.author: Martha Stewart

data.quote: Thank God ever morning when you get up that you have something to do which must be done  whether you like it or not.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it. . . If you have made mistakes  even serious mistakes  there is always another chance for you. . . . for this thing that we call "failure" is not the falling down  but the staying down.
data.author: Mary Pickford

data.quote: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could  some blunders and absurdities have crept in  forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day  you shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Live your life each day as you would climb a mountain. An occasional glance toward the summit keeps the goal in mind  but many beautiful scenes are to be observed from each new vantage point. Climb slowly  steadily  enjoying each passing moment  and the view from the summit will serve as a fitting climax for the journey.
data.author: Harold B. Melchart

data.quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow.
data.author: Mary Jean Iron

data.quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover  but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
data.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

data.quote: When all else is lost  the future still remains.
data.author: Christian Bovee

data.quote: When I look at the future  it's so bright  it burns my eyes.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: Earth's crammed with Heaven  And every common bush afire with God.
data.author: E. B. Browning

data.quote: To him who in the love of Nature holds Communion with her visible forms  she speaks A various language.
data.author: William Cullen Bryant

data.quote: I love not man the less  but nature more.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: For Art may err  but Nature cannot miss.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: The woods were made for the hunter of dreams  The brooks for the fishes of song.
data.author: Sam Walter Foss

data.quote: Nature is a volume of which God is the author.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Nature  like a kind and smiling mother  lends herself to our dreams and cherishes our fancies.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Accuse not Nature  she hath done her part  Do thou but thine!
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Grass is the forgiveness of nature - her constant benediction. ... Forests decay  harvests perish  flowers vanish  but grass is immortal.
data.author: John Ingalls

data.quote: Everything in nature acts in conformity with law.
data.author: Immanuel Kant

data.quote: Nature abhors a vacuum.
data.author: Francois Rabelais

data.quote: To hold  as 't were  the mirror up to nature.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I chatter  chatter  as I flow To join the brimming river  For men may come and men may go  But I go on forever.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: When I would recreate myself  I seek the darkest wood  the thickest and most interminable  and to the citizen  most dismal swamp. I enter a swamp as a sacred place -  a sanctum sanctorum. There is the strength  the marrow of Nature.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Nature has always had more force than education.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: O pilot! 'tis a fearful night  There's danger on the deep.
data.author: Thomas Haynes Bayly

data.quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
data.author: Edward Gibbon

data.quote: Oh  I am a cook and a captain bold And the mate of the Nancy brig  And a bo'sun tight and a midshipmate And the crew of the captain's gig.
data.author: W. S. Gilbert

data.quote: Thus  I steer my bark  and sail On even keel  with gentle gale.
data.author: Matthew Green

data.quote: Hearts of oak are our ships  Hearts of oak are our men.
data.author: David Garrick

data.quote: Now landsmen all  whoever you may be  If you want to rise to the top of the tree. If your soul isn't fettered to an office stool  Be careful to be guided by this golden rule -  Stick close to your desks and never go to to sea  And you may all be Rulers of the Queen's Navee.
data.author: W. S. Gilbert

data.quote: Necessity has no law.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Necessity  the mother of invention.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Necessity is often the spur to genius.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants  it is the creed of slaves.
data.author: William Pitt

data.quote: Necessity makes even the timid brave.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: Not for myself I make this prayer  But for this race of mine That stretches forth from shadowed places Dark hands for bread and wine.
data.author: Countee Cullen

data.quote: The image of God cut in ebony.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: O black and unknown bards of long ago  How came your lips to touch the sacred fire? How  in your darkness  did you come to know The power and beauty of the minstrel's lyre?
data.author: James Weldon Johnson

data.quote: In the Negro countenance you will often meet with strong traits of benignity. I have felt yearnings of tenderness towards some of these faces.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: The best way to uncolor the Negro is to give the white man a white heart.
data.author: Panin

data.quote: The Negro is an exotic of the most gorgeous and superb countries of the world  and he has deep in his heart a passion for all that is splendid  rich and fanciful.
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: We can live without our friends but not without our neighbors.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: When your neighbor's house is afire your own property is at stake.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
data.author: Leviticus

data.quote: The crop always seems better in our neighbor's field  and our neighbor's cow gives more milk.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: In the field of world policy I would dedicate this nation to the policy of the good neighbor.
data.author: F. D. Roosevelt

data.quote: The cold neutrality of an impartial judge.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: Neutrality  as a lasting principle  is an evidence of weakness.
data.author: Louis Kossuth

data.quote: A wise neuter joins with neither  but uses both  as his honest interest leads him.
data.author: William Penn

data.quote: The heart is never neutral.
data.author: Shaftesbury

data.quote: A plague o' both your houses.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A man never tells you anything until you contradict him.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Laws die  books never.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: The English never draw a line without blurring it.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Deep experience is never peaceful.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
data.author: Miss Piggy

data.quote: Never exaggerate your faults  your friends will attend to that.
data.author: Robert C. Edwards

data.quote: You can never plan the future by the past.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: We never live  but we are always in the expectation of living.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: The body never lies.
data.author: Martha Graham

data.quote: Women are never disarmed by compliments. Men always are.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Never invest your money in anything that eats or needs repairing.
data.author: Billy Rose

data.quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Never cut what you can untie.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: I never was ruined but twice - once when I lost a lawsuit  and once when I gained one.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.
data.author: Edward Gibbon

data.quote: I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Never give in  never give in  never  never  never  never - in nothing great or small  large or petty - never give in except to convictions of honour and good sense.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Never trust the teller. Trust the tale.

data.quote: Never have a friend that's poorer than yourself.

data.quote: Never exaggerate your faults  your friends will attend to that.
data.author: Robert C. Edwards

data.quote: You can never plan the future by the past.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: We never live  but we are always in the expectation of living.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: The body never lies.
data.author: Martha Graham

data.quote: Women are never disarmed by compliments. Men always are.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Never invest your money in anything that eats or needs repairing.
data.author: Billy Rose

data.quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Never cut what you can untie.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: I never was ruined but twice - once when I lost a lawsuit  and once when I gained one.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: I was never less alone than when by myself.
data.author: Edward Gibbon

data.quote: I never found the companion that was so companionable as solitude.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Never give in  never give in  never  never  never  never - in nothing great or small  large or petty - never give in except to convictions of honour and good sense.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Never trust the teller. Trust the tale.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Never have a friend that's poorer than yourself.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: We never ask God to forgive anybody except when we haven't.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
data.author: Elizabeth Fuller

data.quote: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.
data.author: Maria Montessori

data.quote: A man never tells you anything until you contradict him.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Laws die  books never.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: The English never draw a line without blurring it.

data.quote: I like to visit New York  but I wouldn't live there if you gave it to me.
data.author: American Saying

data.quote: If there ever was an aviary overstocked with jays it is that Yaptown-on-the-Hudson  called New York.
data.author: O. Henry

data.quote: Vulgar of manner  overfed. Overdressed and underbred  Heartless  Godless  hell's delight  Rude by day and lewd by night  Bedwarfed the man  o'ergrown the brute  Ruled by boss and prostitute  Purple-robed and pauper-clad  Raving  rotting  money-mad  A squirming herd in Mammon's mesh  A wilderness of human flesh  Crazed with avarice  lust and rum  New York  thy name's Delirium.
data.author: Byron R. Newton

data.quote: Spick and span new.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: What is valuable is not new  and what is new is not valuable.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: If a man bites a dog  that is news.
data.author: John Bogart

data.quote: By evil report and good report.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: As cold waters to a thirsty soul  so is good news from a far country.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: There's villainous news abroad.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: When we hear news we should always wait for the sacrament of confirmation.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Freedom of the press in Britain is freedom to print such of the proprietor's prejudices as the advertisers don't object to.
data.author: Hannen Swaffer

data.quote: Newspapers have developed what might be called a vested interest in catastrophe. If they can spot a fight  they play up that fight. If they can uncover a tragedy  they will headline that tragedy.
data.author: Harry A. Overstreet

data.quote: Everything you read in the newspapers is absolutely true  except for that rare story of which you happen to have first-hand knowledge.
data.author: Erwin Knoll

data.quote: I do not take a single newspaper  nor read one a month and I feel myself infinitely the happier for it.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Burke said there were three Estates in Parliament  but in the reporters' gallery yonder  there sat a fourth Estate more important than them all.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Comfort the afflicted and afflict the comfortable.
data.author: Finley Peter Dunne

data.quote: Remember  son  many a good story has been ruined by over-verification.
data.author: James Gordon Bennett

data.quote: Don't be afraid to make a mistake  your readers might like it.
data.author: William Randolph Hearst

data.quote: One newspaper a day ought to be enough for anyone who still prefers to retain a little mental balance.
data.author: Clifton Fadiman

data.quote: Journalism is literature in a hurry.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: The sports page records people's accomplishments  the front page usually records nothing but man's failures.
data.author: Earl Warren

data.quote: If some great catastrophe is not announced every morning  we feel a certain void. 'Nothing in the paper today ' we sigh.
data.author: Paul Valery

data.quote: Carelessness is not fatal to journalism  nor are cliches  for the eye rests lightly on them. But what is intended to be read once can seldom be read more than once  a journalist has to accept the fact that his work  by its very todayness  is excluded from any share in tomorrow.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: He had been kicked in the head by a mule when young  and believed everything he read in the Sunday papers.
data.author: George Ade

data.quote: An editor - a person employed on a newspaper  whose business it is to separate the wheat from the chaff  and to see that the chaff is printed.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: The day you write to please everyone you no longer are in journalism. You are in show business.
data.author: Frank Miller

data.quote: News is the first rough draft of history.
data.author: Benjamin Bradlee

data.quote: It is a newspaper's duty to print the news and raise hell.
data.author: Wilbur F. Storey

data.quote: What you see is news  what you know is background  what you feel is opinion.
data.author: Lester Markel

data.quote: Freedom of the press is guaranteed only to those who own one.
data.author: A. J. Liebling

data.quote: A good newspaper is a nation talking to itself.
data.author: Arthur Miller

data.quote: The first essence of journalism is to know what you want to know  the second  is to find out who will tell you.
data.author: John Gunther

data.quote: Today's reporter is forced to become an educator more concerned with explaining the news than with being first on the scene.
data.author: Fred Friendley

data.quote: A writer who takes up journalism abandons the slow tempo of literature for a faster one and the change will do him harm. By degrees the flippancy of journalism will become a habit and the pleasure of being paid on the nail and more especially of being praised on the nail  grow indispensable.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: Newspapers are the world's mirrors.
data.author: James Ellis

data.quote: Were it left to me to decide whether we should have a government without newspapers or newspapers without government  I should not hesitate a moment to prefer the latter.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Every editor of newspapers pays tribute to the devil.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Four hostile newspapers are more to be feared than a thousand bayonets.
data.author: Napoleon

data.quote: Let me make the newspapers  and I care not what is preached in the pulpit or what is enacted in Congress.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: AH I know is what I see in the papers.
data.author: Will Rogers

data.quote: The Night has a thousand eyes  The Day but one  Yet the light of the bright world dies With the dying sun.
data.author: Francis William Bourdillon

data.quote: For the night Shows stars and women in a better light.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Night's black Mantle covers all alike.
data.author: Guillaume S. du Bartas

data.quote: Watchman  what of the night?
data.author: Isaiah

data.quote: Night  when deep sleep falleth on men.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The night cometh when no man can work.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: And the night shall be filled with music And the cares  that infest the day  Shall fold their tents  like the Arabs  And as silently steal away.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: In a real dark night of the soul it is always three o'clock in the morning.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: The nearer the dawn the darker the night.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: The night is dark  and I am far from home.
data.author: John Henry Newman

data.quote: To all  to each  a fair good night  And pleasing dreams  and slumbers light.
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: Making night hideous.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: It is the hour when from the boughs The nightingale's high note is heard  It is the hour when lovers' vows Seem sweet in every whisper'd word.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Hark! that's the nightingale  Telling the self-same tale Her song told when this ancient earth was young: So echoes answered when her song was sung In the first wooded vale.
data.author: Christina G. Ross

data.quote: The angel of spring  the mellow-throated nightingale.
data.author: Sappho

data.quote: I am not the smartest or most talented person in the world  but I succeeded because I keep going  and going  and going.
data.author: Sylvester Stallone

data.quote: I know the price of success: dedication  hard work and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: Success generally depends upon knowing how long it takes to succeed.
data.author: Charles de Montesquieu

data.quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: If you wish success in life  make perseverance your bosom friend.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: They who are the most persistent  and work in the true spirit  will invariably be the most successful.
data.author: Samuel Smiles

data.quote: If at first you don't succeed  try  try  try again.
data.author: W. E. Hickson

data.quote: If at first you don't succeed  you're running about average.
data.author: M. H. Alderson

data.quote: The secret of success is constancy of purpose.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: The only way to the top is by persistent  intelligent  hard work.
data.author: A. T. Mercier

data.quote: The heights by great men reached and kept Were not attained by sudden flight  But they  while their companions slept Were toiling upward in the night.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: I realized early on that success was tied to not giving up. Most people in this business gave up and went on to other things. If you simply didn't give up  you would outlast the people who came in on the bus with you.
data.author: Harrison Ford

data.quote: Call the roll in your memory of conspicuously successful [business] giants and  if you know anything about their careers  you will be struck by the fact that almost every one of them encountered inordinate difficulties sufficient to crush all but the gamest of spirits. Edison went hungry many times before he became famous.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate  you are sure to wake up somebody.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Four steps to achievement: plan purposefully  prepare prayerfully  proceed positively  pursue persistently.
data.author: William A. Ward

data.quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Diamonds are only lumps of coal that stuck to their jobs.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Persistence is the master virtue. Without it  there is no other.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I'm hardnosed about luck. I think it sucks. Yeah  if you spend seven years looking for a job as a copywriter  and then one day somebody gives you a job  you can say  "Gee  I was lucky I happened to go up there today." But dammit  I was going to go up there sooner or later in the next seventy years. ... If you're persistent in trying and doing and working  you almost make your own fortune.
data.author: Jerry Delia Femina

data.quote: It's the plugging away that will win you the day So don't be a piker old pard! Just draw on your grit  it's so easy to quit- It's the keeping your chin up that's hard.
data.author: Robert W. Service

data.quote: No one succeeds without effort. ... Those who succeed owe their success to their perseverance.
data.author: Ramana Maharshi

data.quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: Be of good cheer. Do not think of today's failures  but of the success that may come tomorrow. You have set yourselves a difficult task  but you will succeed if you persevere  and you will find a joy in overcoming obstacles. Remember  no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That's it. But really be humble about it.... You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
data.author: Alex Haley

data.quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
data.author: Beverly Sills

data.quote: Continuous efforts-not strength or intelligence-is the key to unlocking our potential.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Plodding wins the race.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal: my strength lies solely in my tenacity.
data.author: Louis Pasteur

data.quote: A winner never quits and a quitter never wins.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Men who have attained things worth having in this world have worked while others idled  have persevered when others gave up in despair  have practiced early in life the valuable habits of self-denial  industry  and singleness of purpose. As a result  they enjoy in later life the success so often erroneously attributed to good luck.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: In the realm of ideas  everything depends on enthusiasm  in the real world  all rests on perseverance.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: There's such a thin line between winning and losing.
data.author: John R. Tunis

data.quote: It is easier to begin well than to finish well.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: The great majority of men are bundles of beginnings.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I hope I shall have ambition until the day I die.
data.author: Clare Boothe Luce

data.quote: When you put your hand to the plow  you can't put it down until you get to the end of the row.
data.author: Alice Paul

data.quote: Out of the strain of the Doing  Into the peace of the Done.
data.author: Julia Louise Woodruff

data.quote: Great is the art of beginning  but greater is the art of ending.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: There are two parts to the creative endeavor: making something  then disseminating it.
data.author: Jane Alexander

data.quote: We rate ability in men by what they finish  not by what they begin.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A chicken doesn't stop scratching just because worms are scarce.
data.author: Grandma Axiom

data.quote: Everyone has his superstitions. One of mine has always been when I started to go anywhere  or to do anything  never to turn back or to stop until the thing intended was accomplished.
data.author: Ulysses S. Grant

data.quote: I just kept on doing what everyone starts out doing. The real question is  why did other people stop?
data.author: William Stafford

data.quote: Men perish because they cannot join the beginning with the end.
data.author: Alcmaeon

data.quote: Business is full of brilliant men who started out with a spurt and lacked the stamina to finish. Their places were taken by patient and unshowy plodders who never knew when to quit.
data.author: J. R. Todd

data.quote: I can remember walking as a child. It was not customary to say you were fatigued. It was customary to complete the goal of the expedition.
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: He that has cut the claws of the lion will not feel quite secure until he has also drawn his teeth.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
data.author: Alonzo Newton Benn

data.quote: I went for years not finishing anything. Because  of course  when you finish something you can be judged.... I had poems which were rewritten so many times I suspect it was just a way of avoiding sending them out.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: Let no one 'til his death be called unhappy. Measure not the work Until the day's out  and the labor done: Then bring your gauges.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: All is well that ends well.
data.author: John Heywood

data.quote: Either do not attempt at all  or go through with it.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: In soloing-as in other activities-it is far easier to start something than it is to finish it.
data.author: Amelia Earhart

data.quote: It is a matter first of beginning-and then following through.
data.author: Richard L. Evans

data.quote: Genius begins great works  labor alone finishes it.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: There is but an inch of difference between the cushioned chamber and the padded cell.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: The only way to find out if you can write is to set aside a certain period every day and try. Save enough money to give yourself six months to be a full-time writer. Work every day and the pages will pile up.
data.author: Judith Krantz

data.quote: I work every day-or at least I force myself into my office or room. I may get nothing done  but you don't earn bonuses without putting in time. Nothing may come for three months  but you don't earn the fourth without it.
data.author: Mordecai Richler

data.quote: When nothing seems to help  I go and look at a stonecutter hammering away at his rock perhaps a hundred times without as much as a crack showing in it. Yet at the hundred and first blow it will split in two  and I know it was not that blow that did it  but all that had gone before.
data.author: Jacob A. Riis

data.quote: The drops of rain make a hole in the stone not by violence  but by oft falling.
data.author: Lucretius

data.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go  so long as you do not stop.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: Live with no time out.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: The great thing in this world is not so much where we are  but in what direction we are moving.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: The race is not always to the swift  but to those who keep on running.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My parents told me that people will never know how long it takes you to do something. They will only know how well it is done.
data.author: Nancy Hanks

data.quote: By perseverance the snail reached the Ark.
data.author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

data.quote: Our desire must be like a slow and stately ship  sailing across endless oceans  never in search of safe anchorage. Then suddenly  unexpectedly  it will find mooring for a moment.
data.author: Etty Hillesum

data.quote: The race is not to the swift  nor the battle to the strong.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: If we are facing in the right direction  all we have to do is keep on walking.
data.author: Ancient Buddhist proverb

data.quote: It's the steady  constant driving to the goal for which you're striving  not the speed with which you travel  that will make your victory sure.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I'm a slow walker  but I never walk back.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Slow and steady wins the race.
data.author: Robert Lloyd

data.quote: Character is built into the spiritual fabric of personality hour by hour  day by day  year by year in much the same deliberate way that physical health is built into the body.
data.author: E. Lamar Kincaid

data.quote: No great thing is created suddenly.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Be content to grow a little each day. If the improvement is the sort of thing which is very slow  do not measure it too often. Do a self-comparison every two weeks  or every six months  whatever is appropriate.
data.author: Lewis E Presnall

data.quote: Pray that success will not come any faster than you are able to endure it.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Wisely and slow. They stumble that run fast.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Plodding wins the race.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: The way of progress is neither swift nor easy.
data.author: Marie Curie

data.quote: One thing at a time  all things in succession. That which grows slowly endures.
data.author: J. G. Hubbard

data.quote: Make haste slowly.
data.author: Augustus

data.quote: Slow motion gets you there faster.
data.author: Hoagy Carmichael

data.quote: I'm not there yet  but I'm closer than I was yesterday.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: I am suffocated and lost when I have not the bright feeling of progression.
data.author: Margaret Fuller

data.quote: The lowest ebb is the turn of the tide.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: You give ioo percent in the first half of the game  and if that isn't enough  in the second half you give what's left.
data.author: Yogi Berra

data.quote: Don't get hung up on a snag in the stream  my dear. Snags are not so dangerous-it's the debris that clings to them that makes the trouble. Pull yourself loose and go on.
data.author: Anne Shannon Monroe

data.quote: One can go a long way after one is tired.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: The great thing  and the hard thing  is to stick to things when you have outlived the first interest  and not yet got the second  which comes with a sort of mastery.
data.author: Janet Erskine Stuart

data.quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
data.author: Napoleon Hill

data.quote: If something is boring after two minutes  try it for four. If still boring  try for eight  sixteen  thirty-two  and so on. Eventually  one discovers that it is not boring  but very interesting.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: No one ever did anything worth doing unless he was prepared to go on with it long after it became something of a bore.
data.author: Douglas V. Steere

data.quote: I've been failing for like  ten or eleven years. When it turns  it'll turn. Right now I'm just tryin' to squeeze through a very tight financial period  get the movie out  and put my things in order.
data.author: Francis Ford Coppola

data.quote: In our day  when a pitcher got into trouble in a game  instead of taking him out  our manager would leave him in and tell him to pitch his way out of trouble.
data.author: Cy Young

data.quote: I'm a little wounded  but I am not slain  I will lay me down to bleed a while. Then I'll rise and fight again.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: The tragedy of life is not that man loses  but that he almost wins.
data.author: Heywood Broun

data.quote: Where I am today has everything to do with the years I spent hanging on to a career by my fingernails.
data.author: Barbara Aronstein Black

data.quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man  but he is brave five minutes longer.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Hope says to us constantly  "go on  go on " and leads us to the grave.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Every great work  every big accomplishment  has been brought into manifestation through holding to the vision  and often just before the big achievement  comes apparent failure and discouragement.
data.author: Florence Scovel Shinn

data.quote: The line between failure and success is so fine that we ... are often on the line and do not know it. How many a man has thrown up his hands at a time when a little more effort  a little more patience  would have achieved success. A little more persistence  a little more effort  and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: When you get to the end of your rope  tie a knot and hang on.
data.author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

data.quote: It is with enterprises as with striking fire  we do not meet with success except with reiterated efforts  and often at the instant when we despaired of success.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Saints are sinners who kept on going.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: We can do anything we want to do if we stick to it long enough.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you  'til it seems as though you could not hold on a minute longer  never give up then  for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: Men do not fail  they stop trying.
data.author: Elihu Root

data.quote: It ain't over 'til it's over.
data.author: Yogi Berra

data.quote: Triumph often is nearest when defeat seems inescapable.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Don't bother about genius. Don't worry about being clever. Trust to hard work  perseverance and determination. And the best motto for a long march is  "Don't grumble. Plug on!"
data.author: Sir Frederick Treves

data.quote: Some men give up their designs when they have almost reached the goal  while others  on the contrary  obtain a victory by exerting  at the last moment  more vigorous efforts than before.
data.author: Polybius

data.quote: Never stop. One always stops as soon as something is about to happen.
data.author: Peter Brook

data.quote: Many of life's failures are men who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: Fight one more round. When your feet are so tired you have to shuffle back to the center of the ring  fight one more round.
data.author: James J. Corbett

data.quote: Don't leave before the miracle happens!
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: If something doesn't come up the way you want  you have to forge ahead.
data.author: Clint Eastwood

data.quote: Fortune is like the market  where many times  if you can stay a little  the price will fall.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: This man Wellington is so stupid he does not know when he is beaten  and goes on fighting.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: He never knew when he was whipped ... so he never was.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Entrepreneurs average 3.8 failures before a final success. What sets the successful ones apart is their amazing persistence. There are a lot of people out there with good and marketable ideas  but pure entrepreneurial types almost never accept defeat.
data.author: Lisa M. Amos

data.quote: As long as a person doesn't admit he is defeated  he is not defeated-he's just a little behind  and isn't through fighting.
data.author: Darrell Royal

data.quote: Only yield when you must  never "give up the ship " but fight on to the last "with a stiff upper lip!"
data.author: Phoebe Cary

data.quote: Defeat never comes to any man until he admits it.
data.author: Josephus Daniels

data.quote: There is something in me-I just can't stand to admit defeat.
data.author: Beverly Sills

data.quote: There was no such thing as defeat if you didn't accept it.
data.author: Fay Weldon

data.quote: Never give in! Never give in! Never  never  never  never.... In nothing great or small  large or petty  never give in except to convictions or honor and good sense!
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: First there are those who are winners  and know they are winners. Then there are the losers who know they are losers. Then there are those who are not winners  but don't know it. They're the ones for me. They never quit trying. They're the soul of our game.
data.author: Paul William

data.quote: It's not worthy of human beings to give up.
data.author: Alva Reimer Myrdal

data.quote: Never admit defeat!
data.author: Arthur Rimbaud

data.quote: We shall go on to the end. We shall fight in France  we shall fight with growing confidence and growing strength in the air  we shall defend our island  whatever the cost may be. We shall fight on the beaches  we shall fight on the landing grounds  we shall fight in the fields  and in the streets  we shall fight in the halls. We shall never surrender.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Patient endurance attends to all things.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: To be somebody you must last.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: He conquers who endures.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Emotional maturity is the ability to stick to a job and to struggle through until it is finished  to endure unpleasantness  discomfort and frustration.
data.author: Edward A. Strecker

data.quote: To bear is to conquer our fate.
data.author: Thomas Campbell

data.quote: Keep breathing.
data.author: Sophie Tucker

data.quote: It helps  I think  to consider ourselves on a very long journey: the main thing is to keep to the faith  to endure  to help each other when we stumble or tire  to weep and press on.
data.author: Mary Caroline Richards

data.quote: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last in it  and not be smashed by it.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: The first need of being is endurance  to endure with gladness if we can  with fortitude in any event.
data.author: Bliss Carman

data.quote: I bend  but I do not break.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: He that endureth to the end shall be saved.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Whatever necessity lays upon thee  endure  whatever she commands  do.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: To be somebody you must last.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: In the clutch of circumstance  I have not winced or cried aloud  Under the bludgeoning of chance  my head is bloody  but unbowed.
data.author: William E. Henley

data.quote: We shall live to fight again  and to strike another blow.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Giving up is the ultimate tragedy.
data.author: Robert J. Donovan

data.quote: God Almighty hates a quitter.
data.author: Samuel Fessenden

data.quote: Endurance is one of the most difficult disciplines  but it is to the one who endures that the final victory comes.
data.author: Buddha

data.quote: Endure  and preserve yourselves for better things.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Every kind of fortune is to be overcome by bearing it.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: When we see ourselves in a situation which must be endured and gone through  it is best to make up our minds to meet it with firmness  and accommodate everything to it in the best way practical. This lessons the evil  while fretting and fuming only serve to increase your own torments.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: If you want to see the sun shine  you have to weather the storm.
data.author: Frank Lane

data.quote: If you want the rainbow  you gotta put up with the rain.
data.author: Dolly Parton

data.quote: What cannot be altered must be borne  not blamed.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: He that can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
data.author: Yiddish proverb

data.quote: To struggle when hope is banished. To live when life's salt is gone! To dwell in a dream that's vanished- To endure  and go calmly on!
data.author: Ben Johnson

data.quote: A high heart ought to bear calamities and not flee them  since in bearing them appears the grandeur of the mind  and in fleeing them the cowardice of the heart.
data.author: Pietro Aretino

data.quote: Endurance is nobler than strength  and patience than beauty.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: They merit more praise who know how to suffer misery than those who temper themselves with contentment.
data.author: Pietro Aretino

data.quote: We must endure what fortune sends.
data.author: Greek proverb

data.quote: People can bear anything.
data.author: Philip Slater

data.quote: We must learn from life how to suffer it.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: This is courage in a man: to bear unflinchingly what heaven sends.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
data.author: Bern Williams

data.quote: Obstacles cannot crush me  every obstacle yields to stern resolve.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: And let us not be weary in well doing  for in due season we shall reap  if we faint not.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Hold on with a bulldog grip  and chew and choke as much as possible.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: There remain times when one can only endure. One lives on  one doesn't die  and the only thing that one can do is to fill one's mind and time as far as possible with the concerns of other people. It doesn't bring immediate peace  but it brings the dawn nearer.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: When I look at the kids training today ... I can tell which ones are going to do well. It's not necessarily the ones who have the most natural talent or who fall the least. Sometimes it's the kids who fall the most  and keep pulling themselves up and trying again.
data.author: Michelle Kwan

data.quote: Our greatest glory consists not in never falling  but in rising every time we fall.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: It takes far less courage to kill yourself than it takes to make yourself wake up one more time.
data.author: Judith Rossner

data.quote: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: If I don't get off the mat  I'll lose the fight.
data.author: Archie Moore

data.quote: For a just man falleth seven times  and riseth up again.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Persistent people begin their success where others end in failure.
data.author: Edward Eggleston

data.quote: Think of a fine painter attempting to capture an inner vision  beginning with one corner of the canvas  painting what he thinks should be there  not quite pulling it off  covering it over with white paint  and trying again  each time finding out what his painting isn't  until he finally finds out what it is. And when you finally do find out what one corner of your vision is  you're off and running.
data.author: Anne Lamott

data.quote: Vitality shows not only in the ability to persist  but in the ability to start over.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: Regression in grief must be seen and supported as a means toward adaptation and health.
data.author: Lily Pincus

data.quote: To be happy  drop the words "if only" and substitute instead the words "next time."
data.author: Smiley Blanton

data.quote: Life is a maze in which we take the wrong turning before we learn to walk.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: Education is hanging around until you've caught on.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
data.author: Phyllis Diller

data.quote: You go back to the gym and you just do it again and again until you get it right.
data.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

data.quote: As long as one keeps searching  the answers come.
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: How many years you have to keep on doing  until you know what to do and how to do!
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: There is no wisdom equal to that which comes after the event.
data.author: Geraldine Jewsbury

data.quote: Tolerate the ... process of coming to knowledge or certainty or clarity through sometimes apparently hopeless thickets of confusion or bewilderment. Learn not to be surprised or disheartened by the muddle you inhabit  and not to press too soon for a superficial reprieve.
data.author: Joe David Bellamy

data.quote: Learn to self-conquest  persevere thus for a time  and you will perceive very clearly the advantage which you gain from it.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: What can any of us do with his talent but try to develop his vision  so that through frequent failures we may learn better what we have missed in the past.
data.author: William Carlos Williams

data.quote: All effort is in the last analysis sustained by faith that it is worth making.
data.author: Ordway Tead

data.quote: Competition is easier to accept if you realize it is not an act of oppression or abrasion. ... I've worked with my best friends in direct competition.
data.author: Diane Sawyer

data.quote: Life has no smooth road for any of us  and in the bracing atmosphere of a high aim the very roughness stimulates the climber to steadier steps till the legend  "over steep ways to the stars " fulfills itself.
data.author: W. C. Doane

data.quote: The one who cares the most wins. ... That's how I knew I'd end up with everyone else waving the white flags and not me. That's how I knew I'd be the last person standing when it was all over. ... I cared the most.
data.author: Roseanne Barr

data.quote: If I had refused to institute a negotiation or had not persevered in it  I would have been degraded in my own estimation as a man of honor.
data.author: John Adams

data.quote: I read my own books sometimes to cheer me when it is hard to write  and then I remember that it was always difficult  and how nearly impossible it was sometimes.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: The difference between perseverance and obstinacy is that one comes from a strong will  and the other from a strong won't.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: When you're a professional  you come back no matter what happened the day before.
data.author: Billy Martin

data.quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. ... What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: Desire and hope will push us on toward the future.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: The champ may have lost his stuff temporarily or permanently  he can't be sure. When he can no longer throw his high hard one  he throws his heart instead. He throws something. He just doesn't walk off the mound and weep.
data.author: Raymond Chandler

data.quote: We attempt nothing great but from a sense of the difficulties we have to encounter  we persevere in nothing great but from a pride in overcoming them.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
data.author: Leonardo da Vinci

data.quote: What helps me go forward is that I stay receptive  I feel that anything can happen.
data.author: Anouk Aimee

data.quote: There was a Texas Ranger one time who said that there's no stopping a man who knows he's in the right and keeps a-coming.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: When you get to the end of your rope  tie a knot in it and hang on.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Whatever course you decide upon  there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising which tempt you to believe that your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires ... courage.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: People with good intentions never give up!
data.author: Jane Smiley

data.quote: If I see a door comin' my way  I'm knockin' it down. And if I can't knock down the door  I'm sliding through the window.

data.quote: All my life I've been competing-and competing to win. I came to realize that in this way  this cancer was the toughest competition I had faced yet. I made up my mind that I was going to lick it all the way. I not only wasn't going to let it kill me  I wasn't even going to let it put me on the shelf.
data.author: Babe Didrikson Zaharias

data.quote: I have accepted fear as a part of life-specifically the fear of change. ... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back. ...

data.quote: Tribulation produces perseverance  and perseverance  character  and character  hope.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The unifying of opposites is the eternal process.

data.quote: "Brave admiral  say but one good word: What shall we do when hope is gone?" The words leapt like a leaping sword: "Sail on! sail on! and on!"

data.quote: In Hollywood  all marriages are happy. It's trying to live together afterwards that causes problems.
data.author: Shelley Winters

data.quote: We must dare  and dare again  and go on daring.

data.quote: Austere perseverance  harsh and continuous  may be employed by the least of us and rarely fails of its purpose  for its silent power grows irresistibly greater with time.

data.quote: Grant me the courage not to give up  even though I think it is hopeless.
data.author: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz

data.quote: I try. I am trying. I was trying. I will try. I shall in the meantime try. I sometimes have tried. I shall still by that time be trying.
data.author: Diane Glancy

data.quote: Hard times ain't quit and we ain't quit.
data.author: Meridel Le Sueur

data.quote: All the sugar was in the bottom of the cup.
data.author: Julia Ward Howe

data.quote: I have often been adrift  but I have always stayed afloat.
data.author: David Berry

data.quote: God helps those who persevere.

data.quote: Gnaw your own bone  gnaw at it  bury it  unearth it  gnaw it still.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Like ships  men flounder time and time again.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: To strive  to seek  to find  and not to yield.

data.quote: To keep a lamp burning we have to keep putting oil in it.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: If you stop struggling  then you stop life.
data.author: Huey Newton

data.quote: One thing we learned. To make a start and keep plugging. When I had fights at school  the little while I went  I just bowed my neck and kept swinging until something hit the dirt. Sometimes it was me  but I always got up.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Jesus taught that perseverance is the essential element of prayer. Men must be in earnest when they kneel at God's footstool. Too often we get faint-hearted and quit praying at the point when we ought to begin. We let go at the very point where we should hold on strongest. Our prayers are weak because they are not impassioned by an unfailing and resistless will.
data.author: E. M. Bounds

data.quote: Be strong! It matters not how deep entrenched the wrong How hard the battle goes  the day how long Faint not-fight on! Tomorrow comes the song.

data.quote: Never grow a wishbone  daughter  where your backbone ought to be.
data.author: Clementine Paddleford

data.quote: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure.
