data.quote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: Send your noble blood to market and see what it will bring.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Noble blood is an accident of fortune  noble actions characterize the great.
data.author: Carlo Goldoni

data.quote: Be noble in every thought And in every deed!
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: This was the noblest Roman of them all.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A little nonsense now and then Is relished by the wisest men.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The Owl and the Pussy-Cat went to sea In a beautiful pea-green boat.
data.author: Edward Lear

data.quote: No one is exempt from talking nonsense  the misfortune is to do it solemnly.
data.author: Michel Montaigne

data.quote: Plain as a nose in a man's face.
data.author: Francois Rabelais

data.quote: Give me a man with a good allowance of nose ... when I want any good head-work done I choose a man - provided his education has been suitable - with a long nose.
data.author: Napoleon

data.quote: If the nose of Cleopatra had been a little shorter the whole face of the world would have been changed.
data.author: Pascal

data.quote: Nothing to do but work  Nothing to eat but food  Nothing to wear but clothes  To keep one from going nude.
data.author: Ben King

data.quote: Blessed be he who expects nothing  for he shall never be disappointed.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: They laboriously do nothing.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: A life of nothing's nothing worth  From that first nothing ere his birth  To that last nothing under earth.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: You can have no oath registered in heaven to destroy the Government  while I shall have the most solemn one to "preserve  protect  and defend" it.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Tis not the many oaths that makes the truth  But the plain single vow that is vow'd true.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I'll take thy word for faith  not ask thine oath  Who shuns not to break one will sure crack both.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Obedience alone gives the right to command.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Let they child's first lesson be obedience  and the second will be what thou wilt.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Women are perfectly well aware that the more they seem to obey the more they rule.
data.author: Jules Michelet

data.quote: Let them obey that know not how to rule.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The eye that mocketh at his father  and despiseth to obey his mother  the ravens of the valley shall pick it out  and the young eagles shall eat it.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I give the fight up  let there be an end  A privacy  an obscure nook for me  I want to be forgotten even by God.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: Full many a flower is born to blush unseen  And waste its sweetness on the desert air.
data.author: Thomas Gray

data.quote: How happy is the blameless vestal's lot! The world forgetting  by the world forgot.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: How many a rustic Milton has passed by  Stifling the speechless longings of his heart In unremitting drudgery and care! How many a vulgar Cato has compelled His energies  no longer tameless then  To mold a pin  or fabricate a nail!
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: Thus let me live  unseen  unknown  Thus unlamented let me die  Steal from the world  and not a stone Tell where I lie.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: 'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view  and robes the mountain in its azure hue.
data.author: Thomas Campbell

data.quote: All of us are watchers - of television  of time clocks  of traffic on the freeway - but few are observers. Everyone is looking  not many are seeing.
data.author: Peter M. Leschak

data.quote: As a man is  so he sees.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: My evening visitors  if they cannot see the clock  should find the time in my face.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I keep six honest serving-men they taught me all I know  their names are What and Why and When and How and Where and Who
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: I rather like the world. The flesh is pleasing and the Devil does not trouble me.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: It is the theory that decides what can be observed.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Mystery is not profoundness.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The difference between landscape and landscape is small  but there's a great difference in the beholders.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The eyes are the window of the soul.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: To survive the day is triumph enough for the walking wounded among the great many of us.
data.author: Studs Terkel

data.quote: The eyes believe themselves  the ears believe other people.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
data.author: Robertson Davies

data.quote: The things we see are the mind's best bet as to what is out front.
data.author: Adelbert Ames

data.quote: You can observe a lot just by watching.
data.author: Yogi Berra

data.quote: The eye is the jewel of the body.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The ear tends to be lazy  craves the familiar and is shocked by the unexpected  the eye  on the other hand  tends to be impatient  craves the novel and is bored by repetition.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: The eyes indicate the antiquity of the soul.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: To become the spectator of one's own life is to escape the suffering of life.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: One must always tell what one sees. Above all  which is more difficult  one must always see what one sees.
data.author: Charles Peguy

data.quote: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: Cultivated men and women who do not skim the cream of life  and are attached to the duties  yet escape the harsher blows  make acute and balanced observers.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: People only see what they are prepared to see.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The lower classes of men  though they do not think it worthwhile to record what they perceive  nevertheless perceive everything that is worth noting  the difference between them and a man of learning often consists in nothing more than the latter's facility for expression.
data.author: G. C. Lichtenberg

data.quote: There's none so blind as those who won't see.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Obstinacy and vehemency in opinion are the surest proofs of stupidity.
data.author: Bernard Barton

data.quote: An obstinate man does not hold opinions  but they hold him.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: I hold every man a debtor to his profession  from the which as men of course do seek to receive countenance and profit  so ought they of duty to endeavor themselves  by way of amends  to be a help and ornament thereunto.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: The crowning fortune of a man is to be born to some pursuit which finds him employment and happiness  whether it be to make baskets  or broadswords  or canals  or statues  or songs.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The ugliest of trades have their moments of pleasure. Now  if I were a grave-digger  or even a hangman  there are some people I could work for with a great deal of enjoyment.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: Full many a gem of purest ray serene  The dark unfathomed caves of ocean bear.
data.author: Thomas Gray

data.quote: The breaking waves dashed high On a stern and rock-bound coast. And the woods against a stormy sky  Their giant branches toss'd.
data.author: Felicia D. Hemans

data.quote: Love the sea? I dote upon it - from the beach.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: Praise the sea  but keep on land.
data.author: George Herbert

data.quote: Rocked in the cradle of the deep  I lay me down in peace to sleep.
data.author: Emma Willard

data.quote: The very essence of a free government consists in considering offices as public trusts  bestowed for the good of the country  and not for the benefit of an individual or a party.
data.author: John Caldwell Calhoun

data.quote: If a due participation of office is a matter of right  how are vacancies to be obtained? Those by death are few: by resignation  none.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: This struggle and scramble for office  for a way to live without work  will finally test the strength of our institutions.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: The insolence of office.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Youth troubles over eternity  age grasps at a day and is satisfied to have even the day.
data.author: Dame Mary Gilmore

data.quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: I have come to understand that every day is something to cherish.
data.author: Kerri Strug

data.quote: What a folly to dread the thought of throwing away life at once  and yet have no regard to throwing it away by parcels and piecemeal.
data.author: John Howe

data.quote: Not a day passes over this earth but men and women of note do great deeds  speak great words and suffer noble sorrows.
data.author: Charles Reed

data.quote: We create our fate every day we live.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: Who loses a day loses life.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: May you live all the days of your life.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: If we only knew the real value of a day.
data.author: Joseph Farrell

data.quote: We are involved in a life that passes understanding: our highest business is our daily life.
data.author: John Cage

data.quote: We die daily. Happy those who daily come to life as well.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: He who has lived a day has lived an age.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: Life  we learn too late  is in the living  in the tissue of every day and hour.
data.author: Stephen Leacock

data.quote: To sensible men  every day is a day of reckoning.
data.author: John W. Gardner

data.quote: A day's impact is better than a month of dead pull.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: They deem me mad because I will not sell my days for gold  and I deem them mad because they think my days have a price.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: The proper function of man is to live  not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them.
data.author: Jack London

data.quote: A day  an hour  of virtuous liberty is worth a whole eternity in bondage.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: Live mindful of how brief your life is.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Gladly accept the gifts of the present hour.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Everyone once  once only. Just once and no more. And we also once. Never again.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: Most of us spend our lives as if we had another one in the bank.
data.author: Ben Irwin

data.quote: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
data.author: Sister Elizabeth Kenny

data.quote: While we live  let us live.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: No objects of value ... are worth risking the priceless experience of waking up one more day.
data.author: Jack Smith

data.quote: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time  and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Some days you tame the tiger. And some days the tiger has you for lunch.
data.author: Tug McGraw

data.quote: So teach us to number our days  that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: You have got to own your days and live them  each one of them  every one of them  or else the years go right by and none of them belong to you.
data.author: Herb Gardner

data.quote: The ideal never comes. Today is ideal for him who makes it so.
data.author: Horatio W. Dresser

data.quote: True wisdom lies in gathering the precious things out of each day as it goes by.
data.author: E. S. Bouton

data.quote: The most important thing in our lives is what we are doing now.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: He possesses dominion over himself  and is happy  who can every day say  "I have lived." Tomorrow the heavenly Father may either involve the world in dark clouds  or cheer it with clear sunshine  he will not  however  render ineffectual the things which have already taken place.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Each day  each hour  an entire life.
data.author: Juan Ramon Jimenez

data.quote: The days come and go like muffled and veiled figures sent from a distant friendly party  but they say nothing  and if we do not use the gifts they bring  they carry them as silently away.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Your daily life is your temple and your religion.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: He is only rich who owns the day. There is no king  rich man  fairy  or demon who possesses such power as that.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Life is now ... this day  this hour ... and is probably the only experience of the kind one is to have.
data.author: Charles Macomb Flandrau

data.quote: Gather ye rose-buds while ye may  Old time is still a-flying. And this same flower that smiles today  Tomorrow will be dying.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Seize the hour.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Time  like money  is measured by our needs.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: Nothing is ours except time.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Nothing in business is so valuable as time.
data.author: John H. Patterson

data.quote: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it  and others do just the same with their time.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Possessions dwindle: I mourn their loss. But I mourn the loss of time much more  for anyone can save his purse  but none can win back lost time.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: Riches are chiefly good because they give us time.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: One realizes the full importance of time only when there is little of it left. Every man's greatest capital asset is his unexpired years of productive life.
data.author: Paul W. Litchfield

data.quote: Know the true value of time  snatch  seize  and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness  no laziness  no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: A sense of the value of time ... is an essential preliminary to efficient work  it is the only method of avoiding hurry.
data.author: Arnold Bennett

data.quote: All my possessions for a moment of time.
data.author: Queen Elizabeth I

data.quote: Let me tell thee  time is a very precious gift of God  so precious that it's only given to us moment by moment.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: Pick my left pocket of its silver dime  but spare the right-it holds my golden time!
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: We work not only to produce  but to give value to time.
data.author: Eugene Delacroix

data.quote: Dollars cannot buy yesterday.
data.author: Admiral Harold R. Stark

data.quote: As every thread of gold is valuable  so is every moment of time.
data.author: John Mason

data.quote: Minutes are worth more than money. Spend them wisely.
data.author: Thomas P. Murphy

data.quote: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have  and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Every minute of life carries with it its miraculous value  and its face of eter1nal youth.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Lost time is never found again.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: If a person gives you his time  he can give you no more precious gift.
data.author: Frank Tyger

data.quote: You may ask me for anything you like except time.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: The laboring man and the artificer knows what every hour of his time is worth  and parts not with it but for the full value.
data.author: Lord Clarendon

data.quote: Time isn't a commodity  something you pass around like cake. Time is the substance of life. When anyone asks you to give your time  they're really asking for a chunk of your life.
data.author: Antoinette Bosco

data.quote: Love and time-those are the only two things in all the world and all of life that cannot be bought  but only spent.
data.author: Gary Jennings

data.quote: There is nothing good in this world which time does not improve.
data.author: Alexander Smith

data.quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
data.author: Laertius Diogenes

data.quote: The great rule of moral conduct is  next to God  to respect Time.
data.author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

data.quote: It is the time you have wasted for your rose that makes your rose so important.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: One hour of life  crowded to the full with glorious action and filled with noble risks  is worth whole years of those mean observances of paltry decorum.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: Don't be fooled by the calendar. There are only as many days in the year as you make use of. One man gets only a week's value out of a year while another man gets a full year's value out of a week.
data.author: Charles Richards

data.quote: Our costliest expenditure is time.
data.author: Theophrastus

data.quote: The Importance of Using Time Well How pleasant it is  at the end of the day  No follies to have to repent  But reflect on the past  and be able to say  That my time has been properly spent.
data.author: Ann Taylor

data.quote: I must govern the clock  not be governed by it.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: You are no more exempt from time's inexorable passing than Macbeth. Whether time is your friend or foe depends on how you use it
data.author: Patricia Fripp

data.quote: Millions long for immortality who do not know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
data.author: Susan Ertz

data.quote: The organized person ... makes the most of his time and goes to his bed for the night perfectly relaxed for rest and renewal.
data.author: George Matthew Adams

data.quote: Have regular hours for work and play  make each day both useful and pleasant  and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will be delightful  old age will bring few regrets  and life will become a beautiful success.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: He who every morning plans the transactions of the day and follows out that plan carries a thread that will guide him through the labyrinth of the most busy life. ... If the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incident  chaos will soon reign.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Have a time and place for everything  and do everything in its time and place  and you will not only accomplish more  but have far more leisure than those who are always hurrying.
data.author: Tyron Edwards

data.quote: It is not how many years we live  but rather what we do with them.
data.author: Evangeline Cory Booth

data.quote: During a very busy life I have often been asked  "How did you manage to it all?" The answer is very simple: it is because I did everything promptly.
data.author: Sir Richard Tangye

data.quote: Time cannot be expanded  accumulated  mortgaged  hastened  or retarded.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Seize time by the forelock.
data.author: Pittacus

data.quote: Time is a tyranny to be abolished.
data.author: Eugene Jolus

data.quote: The time which we have at our disposal every day is elastic  the passions that we feel expand it  those that we inspire contract it  and habit fills up the rest.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: The ability to concentrate and to use time well is everything.
data.author: Lee Iacocca

data.quote: Time is an equal opportunity employer. Each human being has exactly the same number of hours and minutes every day. Rich people can't buy more hours. Scientists can't invent new minutes. And you can't save time to spend it on another day. Even so  time is amazingly fair and forgiving. No matter how much time you've wasted in the past  you still have an entire tomorrow. Success depends upon using it wisely-by planning and setting priorities.
data.author: Denis Waitley

data.quote: An Italian philosopher said that "time was his estate"  an estate indeed which will produce nothing without cultivation  but will always abundantly repay the labors of industry  and generally satisfy the most extensive desires  if no part of it be suffered to lie in waste by negligence  to be overrun with noxious plants  or laid out for show rather than for use.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Timely service  like timely gifts  is doubled in value.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: Time is the one thing that can never be retrieved.
data.author: C. R. Lawton

data.quote: We must use time as a tool  not as a crutch.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Make use of time  let not advantage slip.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: O  for an engine to keep back all clocks!
data.author: Ben Johnson

data.quote: You may delay  but time will not.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: He who would make serious use of his life must always act as though he had a long time to live and schedule his time as though he were about to die.
data.author: Emile Littre

data.quote: The highest value in life is found in the stewardship of time.
data.author: Robert M. Fine

data.quote: A stale mind is the devil's breadbox.
data.author: Mary Bly
